website_summaries.verdict: Although it isn't made of any special oils, many consumers who love to cook on cast iron surfaces swear by mineral oil to season them, and it would be hard to find a better deal than this generous portion and multi-purpose product.
pros: All-natural mineral oil, which is a popular choice for seasoning and conditioning cast iron
Doesn't tend to smoke once applied
Company doesn't engage in animal testing
cons: Must be stored in a darkened area away from direct light

website_summaries.verdict: Great price per ounce for a large bottle of mineral oil that's the perfect size for a busy kitchen.
pros: Excellent quality of food-grade mineral oil, as it's safe to use on nearly any item in the kitchen
Works to restore wooden utensils or cutting boards by preventing water absorption
Enriched with vitamin E, so it's safe to use on the skin
cons: Consistency of this mineral oil isn't uniform from bottle to bottle

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: it works great. I am glad I got the big bottle see my before and after pix to see how nice it makes the wood look If this review and photos helped you, please click 'yes' below. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Zona Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Safe for food prep areas and is kind to your nose and skin.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to seal a raw parawood table, which will serve as a food prep & mixing center in my kitchen. So pleasant not to have to deal with the fumes from petroleum based sealers, plus the oil leaves my hands nice and soft. It brings out the gorgeous grain of the wood. Shipping was fast and it arrived in great shape. Price was good and I am a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: CT Yankee gal

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Worked wonders on a teak kitchen table.
customer_reviews.text: It does amazing things to teak! We have a very old teak kitchen table and the poor table has lost most of it's color and had some very noticeable water marks and such on it. This oil and some paper towels made the table look amazing. And it is certainly easy enough to keep looking that way with weekly or as needed touch ups. I bought it for a cutting board, and it certainly works well on that too.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. PinkertonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: YUP- its oil alright.
customer_reviews.text: Its oil... its supposedly food grade.. I'm not a chemist, so I can't verify, but I did use it on a cutting board and I lived long enough to write a review on this. The quality seems good... but then again, its just oil. It is clean and clear and pretty much odorless, all good things. I had a hard time finding this in a brick and mortar, so glad it available here!
customer_reviews.author: user

customer_reviews.title: Creates our favorite cutting board finish
customer_reviews.text: Product was great! We are a small family based company that specializes is fine furniture and custom cutting boards. I have been experimenting with different finishing techniques and products for our cutting boards and bought this to make our own wood butter. This mineral oil is extremely easy to work with and so far, our wood butter made using this product has resulted in our most durable and highest quality finish. Will definitely be purchasing again!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Not certified by nobody No stamp of certification from nobody ...
customer_reviews.text: Not certified by nobody No stamp of certification from nobody not halal not kosher Glycerin is an organic compound known more formally as glycerol. Its common sources are animal fat and vegetable oil. Must have certification
customer_reviews.author: mikhail y.

customer_reviews.title: Works like you expect
customer_reviews.text: If you seek a food-grade mineral oil for treating cutting boards, knife handles, wood utensils...this does the job well. And it it conveniently packaged in a size that assures you won't run out soon. This is a great value for the money. Don't waste time and money on the tiny 8 ounce bottles for $8 to $10.
customer_reviews.author: Perkmeister

customer_reviews.title: 18 oz in a 32 oz bottle
customer_reviews.text: I make wooden cutting boards I use food safe mineral oil to help protect the wood I ordered a 32 oz bottle from amazon for $13.97 it was made by a company named raw and rare when I received the bottle from amazon it had 18 oz in it and no sign of leaking from amazon packaging I contacted raw and rare and they told me that it was a amazon problem not theirs obviously it was not filled at raw and rare I will never again order any thing that comes from raw and rare again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the do it your selfer.
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful stuff. I'm using mine to make a healing salve made with Yarrow. Been in a 1 gallon jar using the sun to infuse the Yarrow into the oil. I'll strain it in 2 more weeks with cheese cloth and mix 6 to 1 in honeybee wax, pour in 5oz jars and give away as presents to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my butcher block countertops. Great product. Goes on smooth, soaks in and leaves no oily residue. Great value for the money. Does exactly what expected..
customer_reviews.author: C. Hines

customer_reviews.title: Good Oil for Cutting Boards
customer_reviews.text: This is good food grade oil. I bought it for chopping blocks and cutting boards. This worked great and is a much better deal than identical "cutting board oil" in small bottles. But, if you will use a lot, buy the gallon size for under $18, but do NOT buy the smaller squeeze bottles, it's all the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: RANDY

customer_reviews.title: this is the best bang for you buck (largest size for its price)
customer_reviews.text: Comparably, this is the best bang for you buck (largest size for its price). I use it to treat my cutting boards. Soaks in well and evenly distributes. No smell, and not overly greasy (I splashed some on my shirt and quickly cleaned it with dish soap and water, and no residual spot). Product arrived one day early so that was nice.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny C

customer_reviews.title: Nice, simple, reliable product
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used any other oils, so I don't have much comparison to contribute to this review. I use it on my butcher's block countertop every couple of weeks, and it seems to be holding up well. It has no odor. I used quite a bit of one bottle on the first coat, but touchups take less oil as time passes. The oil seems to spread more easily after 2-3 applications. I use one bottle every 2-3 months for my 6x3' island. I do tend to ruin papers and bills if I set them on the counter before the oil has completely absorbed (a day or two), but that doesn't bother me too much. Otherwise, works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for maintaining cutting boards
customer_reviews.text: It works well to maintain my wooden cutting boards. I transfer a portion to a smaller squeeze bottle for treating my boards to avoid unexpected spills. It a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Was tired of buying small containers of oil to use on my new butcher block countertops. (And a bit $$$) This is perfect for what I need. The size is a much better value and I don't feel I need to sparingly use it for the counters. I found it went on easy and soaked in nicely
customer_reviews.author: rick lesser

Super easy application, and who knew it had so many other uses! It's awesome!

You can spread the remnants on hands for nice moisturizing effect. I am changing the rating to 5 stars.

After shaking the mineral oil and using it it did an amazing job and my wood cutting board look like new.

product_meta.title: Mineral Oil 32 oz, Food Grade Safe Wood/Bamboo Oil, Cutting Board, Butcher Block Conditioner, Knife Blade, Cast Iron Tools, Pans For Food Kitchen, Vegan by Raw Plus
product_meta.description:
Mineral oil restores dry surfaces and promotes healthy skin and hair for an ultimate nourishing treatment. It is a wonderful natural addition to your beauty routines. Good for preserving razors, knives, stone, and wood. Safe for a multitude of cosmetic application. Tasteless, colorless, odorless. Enriched with vitamin E.




Recommended Use: Apply directly onto wooden or metal tools to restore moisture. Multi-purpose lubricant for remedial treatment. Tasteless, colorless, odorless. Kosher certified. 100% white mineral oil. Do not apply over open wounds, infections, burns, or lacerations. In case of contact with eyes, rinse immediately and seek medical advice. Stop use and ask a doctor if condition worsens or symptoms remain the same. Do not use if tamper evident foil seal under cap is broken or missing. Manufacturer, distributors, and dealers disclaim any liability for misuse of product. Keep out of reach of children. Store in a cool, dry area, away from direct sunlight. Please recycle when empty. Raw Plus Rare does not test on animals.
feature_bullets: Our pure mineral oil is USP food based and organic derived. Kosher certified. Naturally tasteless, colorless, odorless.
Enriched with vitamin e. Safe enough to use as a topical treatment for sensitive, dry, cracked skin like eczema. Can be used to remove makeup without clogging pores.
Restores moisture in dull wooden cutting boards, metal blades, cast iron tools, or soapstone countertops.
32 & 128 fl oz filled in a plastic container with heat sealed foil and resealable cap for leak-proof closure. Ergonomic design handle allows easy grip and carrying convenience.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars515 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
